metadata.title: Moored Sediment Trap Data - Station P, 1982-1999
metadata.description: Time series sediment trap data from 1982-1999 from traps moored at Ocean Station Papa , at one intermediate station (Station C, 1984-1990) and at 4 stations along Line P, from 200, 1000, and 3800m depths.
metadata.notes:
Purpose: Studying the biogeochemical flux at ocean station papa.

Supplemental Information: Risk Justification: Custodian will be leaving soon and has a large quantity of data not secured in a regional data centre.
Risk of Loss: High
Impact Justification: Long term time series (more than 10 years)
Impact of Loss: High
Recommended Action: Bring data to archives
Additional Info: Station P4 is at La Perouse.

Status: In work

Maintenance frequency: None planned

Access constraints: May Be Private

Use constraints: Data before 1994 have been published and can be released. Data after 1994 have not been released. Fe/Al/Cd data have not been quality checked, and therefore are not to be released.

Distribution liability: [unknown]

FGDC metadata date: 20080207

FGDC metadata standard: FGDC Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata

FGDC metadata version: FGDC-STD-1998-1

Native data set environment: Expected Growth Rate: Null

Data quality - Logical consistency: For C:N, biogenic silicate, CaCO3: subsamples of one sample, collected at P26, are analyzed with each set of data to check for continuity.  Zooplankton that likely swam into the trap are removed. Silicate concentrations are compared to prepared standards.
Data quality - Completeness: Dataset Complications: Many gaps in the data due to malfunctioning equipment or difficulty retrieving the traps. Traps were deployed at stations P12, P16, and P20 from 1995-1998 only.
Lineage - Process steps:
  1. Unknown

Distribution liability: [unknown]
Non-digital ordering: Hardcopy Original Exists: Y
Hardcopy Locations: Janet Barwell-Clarke, Rm 1408, IOS
Hardcopy Description: Binders of data sheets
Hardcopy Volume: about 4 2in. binders
Physical Sample Exists: Y
Physical Sample Locations: Janet Barwell-Clarke, Rm 1411, IOS
Physical Sample Volume: several hundred
Physical Sample Description: Vials of dried sediment in various formats: some are on filters, some are not.
Physical Sample Complications: Early samples were poorly labelled; it may be difficult to determine their origin.Some of the early biogenic silicate fractions were poorly labelled (several hundred).
Fees: Ask Custodian

FGDC metadata date: 20080207
FGDC metadata standard: FGDC Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata (version: FGDC-STD-1998-1)
references: Publications: Wong, C.S., F.A. Whitney, D.W. Crawford, K. Iseki, R.J. Matear, W.K. Johnson, J.S. Page, D. Timothy. 1999. Seasonal and interannual variability inparticle fluxes of carbon, nitrogen, and silicon from time series of sediment traps at Ocean Station P, 1982-1993: relationship to changes in subarctic primary productivity. Deep-Sea Research II 46: 2735-2760.

Publications: Wong, C.S., F.A. Whitney, D.W. Crawford, K. Iseki, R.J. Matear, W.K. Johnson, J.S. Page, D. Timothy. 1999.
